title: Besieged on a 'Taliban-made island,' Kandahar's residents see no way out
description: • Resurgent Taliban takes provincial capital

title: This is what the frontline of Taliban's advance looks like
description: Afghanistan's swift descent into violence following the withdrawal of US and NATO troops supporting the government has shocked many. Afghan commandos gave CNN's Clarissa Ward exclusive access to one of their bases along Kandahar's front line amid fears it, with other provincial capitals, will fall.

title: GOP official who mocked masks and vaccine dies from virus
description: Texas Republican official H. Scott Apley, a raging critic of masks and the vaccine, died in the hospital from coronavirus. CNN's Tom Foreman reports.

title: Bolsonaro is sowing doubt in Brazil's electoral system. His claims could endanger his own candidacy.
description: As Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro falls further and further behind in the polls, his unsupported claim that the 2022 elections could be rigged have only increased in fervor and frequency. But those freewheeling statements have now sparked investigations that could threaten his very eligibility to run as a presidential candidate at all.

title: Australia's lockdown hasn't let her see her mom since March 2020
description: Kateryna Dmytriyeva hasn't seen her mother since March 2020 due to the Covid-19 lockdown in Australia. She aims to help other families reunite with their loved ones as Australians urge the government to change travel restrictions.

title: First US Capitol rioter pleads guilty to assaulting police officer
description: A New Jersey gym owner and former MMA fighter pleaded guilty on Friday to assaulting a police officer during the January 6 insurrection, marking the first time a Capitol rioter has been convicted of violence against police.

title: Besieged on a 'Taliban-made island,' Kandahar's residents see no way out as militants advance closer
Pentagon investigative team says Iran was behind attack on tanker off coast of Oman
Tigrayan fighters reportedly seize control of UN World Heritage Site in Ethiopia
description: Fighters from Ethiopia's war-torn Tigray region have seized control of a UN World Heritage Site in a neighboring region, Reuters and AFP reported, citing eyewitnesses.

title: Creed Bratton jokes about rough time he had on 'The Office'
description: Creed Bratton joins New Day to talk about 'The Office' and his reflections from his time on the show.

title: Spirit Airlines cancels hundreds of more flights on Friday and vows 'reductions in cancellations'
description: Spirit Airlines -- which has been beset by flight disruptions all week -- canceled almost 300 flights as midday Friday ET, according to data from FlightAware.

title: South Dakota's Sturgis Motorcycle Rally: A 'cautionary tale' in the age of Covid-19
description: Duston Van Balen took a road trip with his family and a wooden urn containing the ashes of a man he considered a brother, with stops at the Grand Canyon in Arizona and Zion National Park in southwest Utah.

title: Indonesian army hints at ending invasive 'virginity tests' for female recruits
description: The Indonesian army has hinted that it will end mandatory "virginity tests" for female recruits, in a move that has been welcomed by human rights groups.

title: Virgin Voyages' first cruise ship sets sail
description: The first Virgin Voyages cruise ship with paying passengers on board is setting sail Friday August 6, after Covid-induced delays pushed back the launch of the Richard Branson-owned cruise line by over a year.

title: China doubles down on baseless 'US origins' Covid conspiracy as Delta outbreak worsens
description: As Beijing grapples with a worsening outbreak of the Delta variant, an outlandish conspiracy theory linking the origin of the coronavirus to the United States military has gained renewed traction in China.

title: Britney Spears just bought her first ever iPad and she's beyond excited
description: Britney Spears has cause for celebration -- she's finally the proud owner of an iPad, calling it "a ground-breaking day."

title: This 12-year-old won silver at her first Olympics
description: CNN's Selina Wang talks with Japanese skateboarder Kokona Hiraki about winning a silver medal at the age of 12 at the 2020 Olympic Games.

title: 'Life-saving warning': How Space Force detected missile launch
description: Russia, China and other adversaries are launching attacks designed to damage or destroy US satellites and interfere with that critical infrastructure. CNN's Jim Sciutto gets an exclusive look into how Space Force is fighting every day to defend against these technologies.

title: Boris Johnson continued a trip to Scotland despite an official testing positive for Covid-19
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson continued a tour of Scotland after a member of his team tested positive for Covid-19, deciding not to self-isolate even as others on the trip did.

title: Coke is changing the recipe of a popular drink. A lot could go wrong
description: If you've had a sip of Coke Zero Sugar recently and thought that it tastes a little different, you're not crazy. The company is rolling out across the United States a new version of the beverage designed to taste more like regular Coke.

title: Arrest made in hit and run death of 'Gone Girl' actress
description: An arrest has been made in the hit and run incident that led to death of "Gone Girl" actress Lisa Banes in June.

title: Community rallies behind kids after money is stolen from lemonade stand
description: Police in Ames, Iowa, rallied the community to support two kids after the money they earned from their lemonade stand was stolen.

title: How nail art became an Olympic beauty ritual
description: As Olympic sprinter Dina Asher-Smith sailed over the finish line in the women's 100 meter semifinals, photos captured her vibrant blue nails as she celebrated. It may have seemed like just another of Asher-Smith's stylish competition looks, but zooming in on her manicure revealed a meticulous recreation of a Japanese masterpiece: Hokusai's "The Great Wave off Kanagawa."

title: Kanye West's latest listening party stirs hope of Kim Kardashian reconciliation
description: Kanye West hosted another listening event in Atlanta for his "Donda" album, but there was more chatter about his personal life than music.

title: Juventus apologizes for racist post shared on women's team's Twitter feed
description: Juventus has apologized after a tweet was posted on its women's team's official account showing a player making a racist gesture towards Asian people.

title: Taylor Swift drops cryptic video for re-release of 'Red'
description: Taylor Swift is hinting at the music and collaborators on the long-awaited re-release of "Red."

title: An ocean system crucial to life on Earth is showing alarming signs of instability
description: A crucial system of currents in the Atlantic Ocean that helps control temperatures in the Northern Hemisphere and has implications for the entire planet's weather systems is showing signs of instability due to human-made climate change, scientists say.

title: Trump's attempted coup: Who are the insiders and will they testify?
description: Key members of former president Donald Trump's justice department could face questioning from the house select committee investigating the insurrection. CNN's Elie Honig details the characters involve.

title: In photos: Europe battles wildfires amid scorching heatwaves
description: A summer of record-setting heat in southern Europe has set off devastating wildfires that have torn through forests, homes and destroyed vital infrastructure from Turkey to Spain.

title: What you should know about the most underrated form of exercise
description: For many of us, walking doesn't seem like anything special. It's just something we do every day. But walking is actually one of the best forms of exercise out there.

title: Valentino Rossi calls time on MotoGP, looks to cars
description: Valentino Rossi, one of the greatest and most charismatic of motorcycling champions, called time on his MotoGP career on Thursday and looked forward to a future in car racing.

title: How a deepfake Tom Cruise on TikTok turned into a very real AI company
description: Earlier this year, videos of Tom Cruise started popping up on TikTok of the actor doing some surprisingly un-Tom-Cruise-like stuff: goofing around in an upscale men's clothing store; showing off a coin trick; growling playfully during a short rendition of Dave Matthews Band's "Crash Into Me."

title: Jailed former South African President Zuma admitted to hospital for medical observation
description: Jailed former South African president Jacob Zuma has been admitted to an outside hospital for medical observation, the country's Department of Correctional Services (DCS) said Friday in a statement.

title: First glimpse inside new star-studded Pirelli calendar
description: The days of stadium concerts may feel like a distant memory, but singer-turned-photographer Bryan Adams is recreating the touring lifestyle with the likes of Iggy Pop, Jennifer Hudson and Grimes for this year's Pirelli calendar.

title: I've had this name all my life. Why should I change it to my husband's?
Indonesia just had its biggest-ever IPO
description: An e-commerce company has just pulled off Indonesia's biggest initial public offering ever. It's the latest sign that Southeast Asia's startup community is taking off.

title: Amazon just scored a major win in the battle for India's retail market
description: India's top court has handed Amazon a major victory in its fight with Reliance Industries for the country's growing e-commerce market.

title: 5 ways parents can support their tweens when a friendship ends
description: Another child doesn't want to be friends with you child anymore. It might feel like the end of the world to your child when it happens, but the end of childhood friendships in middle school is more common than many tweens or parents realize.

title: 'Humility over hubris': See the most heartwarming moments from Tokyo 2020
description: High jumpers sharing gold; competitors celebrating their rivals' success; runners helping fallen athletes back to their feet. The Tokyo games have seen intense competition, but will be remembered for feats of sportsmanship and kindness. CNN's Will Ripley takes a look at the heartwarming moments of the 2020 Olympics.

title: See these Nigerian comedians try to out-joke each other
description: In Nigeria, Africa's most populous country, an emerging crop of young comics are leveraging social media to create video content that makes people laugh -- and makes money.

title: Manila residents crowd vaccination centers in rush before lockdown
description: Residents in the Philippine capital are rushing to get Covid-19 vaccines, crowding into vaccination centers and waiting in long lines outside, ahead of a two-week lockdown that goes into effect Friday evening.

title: Militia finds 40 bodies in Myanmar jungle after army crackdown, says UN envoy
description: A Myanmar militia force fighting the army in a central part of the country and residents have found at least 40 bodies in jungle areas in recent weeks, including some showing signs of torture, said a militia member and Myanmar's UN envoy.

title: Chinese regulators eye unruly online fans, pop culture shows as their next crackdown targets
description: Chinese internet and media regulators are pledging to come down hard on "unhealthy" online fan groups as supporters of pop star Kris Wu took to social media to vehemently defend him against allegations of rape.

title: She tested positive for Covid-19 one week before her due date. Hear her story
description: The advice on whether pregnant women should get vaccinated has changed wildly over the course of the pandemic, and it's left many who are expecting uncertain about their decision-making. CNN's Salma Abdelaziz speaks to a new mom who tested positive one week before her due date.
